sailpoint.object

Class RemediationItem

  • java.lang.Object
    • sailpoint.tools.xml.AbstractXmlObject
      • sailpoint.object.SailPointObject
        • sailpoint.object.RemediationItem
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, AssignableItem, sailpoint.tools.xml.PersistentXmlObject, sailpoint.tools.xml.XMLReferenceTarget

    public class RemediationItem
extends SailPointObject
implements AssignableItem
    Used to represent a single remediation request that can be included in a work item.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • RemediationItem

        public RemediationItem()

      • RemediationItem

        public RemediationItem(java.lang.String certItemId,
               RemediationItem.RemediationEntityType type,
               java.lang.String remediationIdentity,
               CertificationAction action,
               ProvisioningPlan plan)
        Constructor.
        Parameters:
        certItemId - The ID of the certification ID.
        type - Type of object being remediated
        remediationIdentity - The name of the user being remediated.
        action - The CertificationAction with the remediation information.
        plan - ProvisioningPlan to describe extra remediation details

      • RemediationItem

        public RemediationItem(Identity actor,
               java.lang.String remediationIdentity,
               RemediationItem.RemediationEntityType type,
               ProvisioningPlan plan,
               java.lang.String description,
               java.lang.String comments)
        Create a new remediation item that does not belong to a certification. An example is the standalone remediation of policy violations.
        Parameters:
        actor - Identity requesting this remediation
        remediationIdentity - The name of the user being remediated.
        type - Type of object being remediated
        plan - The ProvisioningPlan to execute to remediate the item.
        description - Textual description provided by the actor
        comments - Comments created by the actor

    • Method Detail

      • hasName

        public boolean hasName()
        Description copied from class: SailPointObject
        Return true if the object has a name. This is used by the AbstractSailPointObject and the PersistenceManagers to tell if the name can be used in a search filter.

        It is almost always true, but a few classes like log records do not have meaningful names. Consider using ObjectUtil.hasName(SailPointContext, Class) instead

        Overrides:
        hasName in class SailPointObject

      • getCertificationItem

        public java.lang.String getCertificationItem()
        The ID of the CertificationItem that is being remediated. Storing as a string ID rather than an object reference because Certifications may be archived while the work item is still alive.
